frameDefinitions: The LUs in this frame describe the level that a Rate, or the variation in some quantity over a period of time, deviates from the norm.
In this frame an Action is evaluated with respect to how fairly, justly or equitably the Action affects the Affected_party.

A Manner describes general or specific characteristics of an event in one of three ways:  First, it can refer to how a Comparison_event transpires, absent the influence of an entity (e.g. 'the way you talk').
Two or more distinct entities, which may be concrete or abstract objects or types, are characterized as being similar to each other.
There exist a number of different possible Situations that may happen in the future.
An Entity persists in a stable situation called a State
frameExamples: The <t>rapid</t> increase in obesity is a major cause of concern.
Smithers was being very <t>fair</t> about the distribution of supplies.
He completed the task in a fervent <t>manner</t>.

A mulberry is very <t>similar</t> in shape
to a loganberry
You have but two <t><fex name='Situation'>choices</fex></t> for your daughter .
listRoleDefinitions: The <fen>Event</fen> whose <fen>Rate</fen> is being described.
The <fen>Rate</fen> at which something happens during an <fen>Event</fen>.
The <fen>Actor</fen> is the individual who performs the <fen>Action</fen> and can thus be characterized with repsect to how that <fen>Action</fen> affects the <fen>Affected_party</fen>.
The <fen>Action</fen> is judged based on how just and appopriate it is to the <fen>Affected_party</fen> in a particular situation.
The <fen>Grounds</fen> is the event or state that requires some decision or action in response to it for which the <fen>Actor</fen> is judged.
The <fen>Affected_party</fen>'s treatment is what determines the evaluation of the <fen>Actor</fen>'s <fen>Action</fen>.

The <fen>Comparison_event</fen> is the principal event being characteriszed by the <fen>Manner</fen>. The <fen>Manner</fen> of this <fen>Comparison_event</fen> is often used in comparison with the <fen>Foreground_event</fen>.
The <fen>Salient_entity</fen> that is associated with or directly responsible for the <fen>Comparison_activity</fen>.
The description of the <fen>Comparison_event</fen> or <fen>Comparison_activity</fen>.
A description of the <fen>Manner</fen>.
The <fen>Salient_entity</fen> conducts or engages in the <fen>Comparison_activity</fen> that is being described.
This role marks constituents that express the set of objects or types whose similarity is at issue.

When there is an asymmetry, <fen>Entity_1</fen> is the entity characterized by its similarity to <fen>Entity_2</fen>, whose characteristics are assumed to be known.  <fen>Entity_1</fen> is often an external argument.

When the <fen>Entities</fen> are expressed separately, <fen>Entity_2</fen> is the one whose characteristics are assumed to be known; it serves as a basis for establishing characteristics of <fen>Entity_1</fen>.
This role marks constituents which express a property in respect to which the similarity of the entities is assessed.
A fact about <fen>Entity_1</fen> or the <fen>Entities</fen> that reveals how <fen>Entity_1</fen> is the same or different from other entities.  (Note the contrast with 'as to'.)
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the similarity occurs or exists.
The Place is the general area in which similarity occurs or exists
Something that may happen in the future, or at least whose factual status is unresolved. This is often tagged in a second role layer and generally contains the target.

An individual involved in the <fen>Event</fen>.

'<fex name='Agent'>You</fex> have a <t>choice</t>.'
An entity intimately involved in the <fen>Event</fen>.
Concrete or abstract entity
State of an Entity.
listRoleExamples: Anthony marveled at the rapid <fex>rate</fex> of production.
<fex>The two painters</fex> were alike in being unable to draw acceptably .
In the first phase <fex>Barthes's approach</fex> has similarities to that of Levi-Strauss.
The results of Method 2 show remarkable similarity <fex>to those obtained by Method 1</fex>
The disc announced Friday is <fex>physically</fex> similar to current music CDs
His presidency was different <fex>in that it offered a way forward for the common man</fex> .
You have one choice to make <fex>for him</fex>.

sourceCandidateSpans.text: the State University of New York
one person per ten square miles
the end of our first day
